intro: Pittosporum fragrantissimum, commonly known as the sweet-smelling pittosporum, is a shrub or small tree native to New Zealand. It is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of fragrant, white flowers that bloom in spring. The plant produces small, round berries that are edible but not particularly flavorful. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often cultivated for its ornamental value and aromatic foliage. Pittosporum fragrantissimum is also valued in traditional Māori medicine for its various therapeutic properties.
